description.narrative: Den föreslagna insatsen "Forum Syds Civilsamhällsstöd till Liberia 2016-2017" innebär en begäran från Forum Syd till Ambassaden på SEK 2 013 377 för att finansiera en inledningsfas på tolv månader i Liberia. Syftet med inledningsfasen är att bidra till att stärka det civila samhället genom ökat demokratiskt inflytande samt ökat utkrävande av rättigheter av marginaliserade kvinnor och män. Inledningsfasen är avsedd att stödja utformandet av ett långsiktigt förslag från Forum Syd som grundar sig på (i) relevant, välstrukturerad och effektiv programdesign, (ii) är baserad på den liberianska kontexten och det civila samhället, (iii) inkluderar fattiga och marginaliserade människor. Under inledningsfasen planerar Forum Syd att genomföra ett antal litteraturstudier och konsultationer med civilsamhällsorganisationer och lokalsamhällsorganisationer i Liberia.

The proposed contribution 'Forum Syd Civil Society Support to Liberia 2016-2017' is a request to the Embassy from Forum Syd Liberia for SEK 2 013 377 to fund a 12 month inception phase in Liberia. The purpose of the inception phase is to contribute to a strengthened civil society in Liberia with increased democratic influence and marginalized women and men increasingly exercising their rights more successfully. The inception phase is intended to assist Forum Syd deliver a long term proposal based on relevant, well-structured and efficient programme design based on the contextual needs of the Liberian civil society including poor and marginalized people. During this inception phase, Forum Syd plans to undertake a number of desk studies and consultative meetings with civil society organizations and CBOs in Liberia.

The intended outcome of the development intervention is: a long-term proposal based on relevant, well-structured and efficient programme design based on the contextual needs of Liberian civil society including poor and marginalized people.

description.narrative: Forum Syd successfully completed an inception phase that resulted in the presentation of an application for long term capacity building for civil society in Liberia in line with the intended outcome of the inception phase. Forum Syd’s application was supported by a community based assessment undertaken in 9 out of the 15 counties of Liberia. The comprehensive community based field research provided reliable, relevant and sufficient baseline information that has informed the development of Forum Syd's application to the Embassy of Sweden in Monrovia. The assessment documented the existence of variety of local groups at the community level that were organized around themes such as economic empowerment and agriculture (farmers collective, charcoal producers associations, saving clubs); education (parent teachers associations and school committees); and cultural and sports associations. Forum Syd found that the existence of the community based groups offerred the foundation and entry point to catalyze local ownership and self-reliance. Forum Syd identified skills and competency development in planning, collective advocacy and awareness on environment, climate and human rights as priority for long term capacity development of the local organizations. As a result of the inception phase completed by Forum Syd, the Embassy and other development partners involved with civil society development in Liberia have evidence based research of the different community based initiatives and grassroots movements in Liberia. The main conclusion of the inception phase which supported the designed of Forum Syd long term proposal was that local ownership is important, that Liberian organizations at local level have enormous need for capacity development and are open and willing to cooperate for external actors to benefit to mentoring and capacity strengthening assistance.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
